page.title: 08SMALLHOLDING - POTT SHRIGLEY
page.content: Homestead Farm is not a typical farm in Pott Shrigley. Situated in a sheltered valley below open moorland, with the old stone house of Pott Mill as its centre, its 10 acres of land is given over to rearing pedigree goats, sheep & pigs. The owners are members of the Rare Breeds Survival Trust. Sheep are mainly Herdwicks, Rylands & North Ronaldsays.The goats are British Saanen, Anglo-Nubian, British Alpine & Toggenberg.They also own a valuable Angora male-goat.Tamworth pigs are in danger of extinction today but at "Homestead"they have several sows & a boar.A Dexter cow, two ponies,hens ducks & geese complete the livestock cared for by this enthusiastic family, to whom old-fashioned farming is not just a full time job but a way of life.
